results.title: Division of human tumor cells = Teilung von menschlichen tumorzellen
results.creator_credit: H. Lettre and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: The film shows human tumour cells which have been removed from a patient with carcinoma of the stomach. The cells are contained in the ascitic fluid drawn off from the patient and are observed in this fluid for several hours after removal. A phase-contracts microscope is used with a magnification of 900 times. The conditions for the continued growth and division of the cells are not the most favourable and, in general, only preparations for divisions are observed. However, a normal cell division has been recorded and also a case of tetra-polar division. Silent, with captions in German.

results.title: Diving: no place for cowards
results.creator_credit: Gary Toole, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The top of a ten-meter diving tower is no place for cowards, according to Jim Lambie, the vociferous coach of two of Canada’s top female divers, Janet Nutter and Linda Cuthbert. In this film we see what goes into making a champion performer and the complete faith and loyalty the athletes have towards Lambie despite his brusque manner. A highlight of the film is the close diving competition at the 1978 Commonwealth Games in Edmonton.

results.title: Diving fundamentals
results.creator_credit: Norman L. Sper and New Official Films
results.brief_description: Opens with a brief history of the sport of diving followed by a demonstration and explanation of the fundamental techniques of diving including the correct way of take-off and lift, entry into the water, proper arm action and body positioning. Commentary by Ken Carpenter. Instruction by Fred Cady.

results.title: Divided we stand
results.creator_credit: Rizu Hamid, Olga Edridge and BBC
results.brief_description: What was expected to be the formation of a “New Germany”, representing features of both the East and the West, has not occurred with re-unification. This program examines the problems and the disappointments that East Germans have had to confront since re-unification.
results.description: What was expected to be the formation of a “New Germany”, representing features of both the East and the West, has not occurred with re-unification. This program examines the problems and the disappointments that East Germans have had to confront since re-unification.

results.title: Divided trail: a Native American odyssey
results.brief_description: Uses archival footage and stills to document the beginnings of the American Indian protest movement in Chicago during the 1970s. Three leaders of the movement recount the events which motivated them to bring public attention to the plight of the American Indian, who has left the reservation with promises of employment and a better life only to find unemployment, slums and alcoholism.

results.title: Distant islands
results.creator_credit: Bettina Maylone, Jack Long and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: As in her previous film, the award-winning The Hometown, the filmmaker has used applique and embroidered tapestries to animate a story from her childhood. Distant Islands recalls a young girl’s happy summers spent sailing with her family off the coast of British Columbia. Each tapestry, meticulously stitched by hand with brightly colored yarns, evokes a memory of leisurely days at sea, drifting among the islands.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bettina Maylone, Jack Long and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Distinguished guests
results.creator_credit: Louise Meek, Loretta Fisher, AFTRS and P.J. Hogan
results.brief_description: Christopher (Colin Friels) is sure he really likes psychology - but not the way it is taught at his university. Professor Wiseman, his tutor, is a disciple of the eminent European pyschologist, Professor Eisenbach - a cold rational behaviourist whose books are always cited as authorities. As a joke, Christopher and his girlfriend decide that he will impersonate Eisenbach and teach Professor Wiseman a lesson. Co-written by PJ Hogan (Muriel’s Wedding). Also features Tracy Mann.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louise Meek, Loretta Fisher, AFTRS and P.J. Hogan

results.title: Morris loves Jack
results.brief_description:
Morris loves Jack - or does he?
Jack is a young, dedicated policewoman who lives with Morris, a charming but lazy layabout. But he has become a habit she can’t break and so she puts up with the frustrations and disappointments of living with him - until one night the police are called to a noisy party…Cast includes Kris McQuade, John Hargreaves, Bill Hunter and David Boyd.

results.title: Perception structure or flow (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bob Nichol and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Seeing is believing, and believing is seeing, says this film, in an engaging, involving exanimation of what perception is - what causes one person to see things one way, another person in a totally different way. A film to stimulate discussion, especially in the classroom at senior levels.
